element.name: TEditStyle
element.short: Indicates the editor style for items in TValueListEditor

descr.p: TEditStyle is an enumeration type with values that indicates the editor style used for items in TValueListEditor. TEditStyle is the type used for the TItemProp.EditStyle property.

element.name: TEditStyle.esSimple
element.short: Displays an editor without decoration for the cell

element.name: TEditStyle.esEllipsis
element.short: Displays an ellipsis button next to the cell editor

element.name: TEditStyle.esPickList
element.short: Displays a pick list for the cell editor

element.name: TVleSortCol
element.short: Indicates the sort order for items in TValueListEditor

descr.p: TVleSortCol is an enumeration type with values that indicate the sort order for items in TValueListEditor. Values in TVleSortCol refer to the ordinal position of the column used in the overloaded TValueListEditor.Sort method.

element.name: TVleSortCol.colKey
element.short: The Key column is used to sort items

element.name: TVleSortCol.colValue
element.short: The Value column is used to sort iterms

element.name: TItemProp
element.short: Represents items in the TValueListEditor control

descr.p: TItemProp is a TPersistent descendant that represents items in the TValueListEditor control. TItemProp provides properties and methods to define the editor used for a Key-Value pair. These include the editor style, editing mask, maximum length, pick list values, and read-only status for the item.
TItemProp maintains a reference to the TValueListEditor for the item, and allows access to the properties, methods, and events for the control.
TItemProp is the type used for items in the TItemPropList container, and in the TValueListEditor.ItemProps property.

element.name: TItemProp.AssignTo
element.short: Stores property values to the specified persistent object

descr.p: AssignTo is a procedure used to store property values for the class instance in the specified persistent object. AssignTo ensures that Dest is a ItemProp class instance prior to storing the following properties in the target:
If Dest is not a TItemProp class instance, the inherited AssignTo method is called.

element.name: TItemProp.AssignTo.Dest
element.short: Persistent object to receive values from the class

element.name: TItemProp.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited method. Create ensures that the TValueListEditor instance in AOwner is used as the owner of the item.

element.name: TItemProp.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance

element.name: TItemProp.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy is the destructor for the class instance. Destroy frees resources allocated for the PickList property, and calls the inherited Destroy method.

element.name: TItemProp.EditMask
element.short: Specifies the edit mask used when editing the item

descr.p: EditMask is a String property which specifies the edit mask used when editing the item in TValueListEditor. EditMask can contain the edit mask notation used in TMaskEdit, such as:

dl.dd: Quotes the following character; ie. '\-' inserts the literal '-' character
Converts following characters to upper case
Converts following characters to lower case

descr.p: Changing the value in EditMask causes the TValueListEditor (which owns the item) to be redrawn when its EditorMode is True.
EditStyle is a TEditStyle property which indicates the editor style to use for the item value. See TEditStyle for more information about the enumeration values and their meanings.
Changing the value in EditStyle causes the TValueListEditor (which owns the item) to be redrawn when its EditorMode is True.
descr.remark: Adding values to the PickList for the item overrides the value esSimple in EditStyle at run-time; the value esPickList will automatically be used.

element.name: TItemProp.KeyDesc
element.short: Describes the Key for the item in TValueListEditor

descr.p: KeyDesc is a String property that describes the Key portion of the Key-Value pair in TValueListEditor.

element.name: TItemProp.PickList
element.short: Values that can be selected for the item in TValueListEditor

descr.p: PickList is a TStrings property which contains values that can be selected for the item in TValueListEditor. Values in PickList are displayed using a ComboBox-style drop down when editing the item.

Reading the value in PickList ensures that a TStringList class instance is assigned for the property. Its OnChange event handler is set to the private PickListChange method which adjusts the EditStyle to match the intended usage for the item. In other words, an EditStyle of esSimple is changed to esPickList when it contains values.
Writing the value in PickList causes existing values to be overwritten with the new values. The TValueListEditor (which owns the item) is redrawn when its EditorMode is True.

element.name: TItemProp.MaxLength
element.short: Specifies the maximum length of the item value

descr.p: MaxLength is an Integer property that specifies the maximum length of the item value in TValueListEditor. Changing the value in MaxLength causes the TValueListEditor (which owns the item) to be redrawn when its EditorMode is True.

element.name: TItemProp.ReadOnly
element.short: Indicates if the value for the item can be changed

descr.p: ReadOnly is a Boolean property which indicates if the value for the item can be changed in TValueListEditor. When ReadOnly contains True, the value for the item cannot be changed. Changing the value in ReadOnly causes the TValueListEditor (which owns the item) to be redrawn when its EditorMode is True.

element.name: TItemPropList
element.short: Implements a storage container for items added to TValueListEditor

descr.p: TItemPropList is a class which implements a storage container for items added to TValueListEditor. TItemPropList uses a TFPObjectList member variable to store the TItemProp instances in the list. A TValueListStrings member variable is used as the owner of the list.
Properties and Methods are provided to add or maintain the items in the list. Use Items (the default property for the container) to read or write the items defined in the list.

element.name: TItemPropList.Add
element.short: Appends the specified item to the list

descr.p: Add is a procedure used to append the specified item to the list. Add appends the TItemProp value in AValue to the internal list for the container. Use Items to access the items in the list by their ordinal position.
Use Insert to insert a new item at a specific ordinal position in the list. Use Delete to remove an item in the container. Use Clear to remove all items in the container.

element.name: TItemPropList.Add.AValue
element.short: Item to add to the container

element.name: TItemPropList.Assign
element.short: Sets the items in the container to the specified values

descr.p: Assign is a procedure which sets the items in the container to the values specified in Source. Assign iterates over the TItemProp instances in Source, and creates new TItemProp instances and calls Assign to update the persistent objects. The newly created items are added to the list for the container.
No actions are performed in the method when Source is unassigned (contains Nil).

element.name: TItemPropList.Assign.Source
element.short: New values to store in the list for the container

element.name: TItemPropList.Clear
element.short: Removes all items in the container

descr.p: Clear is a procedure used to remove all items in the container. Clear calls the TFPObjectList.Clear method to remove all TItemProp instances stored in the list.
Use Delete or Insert to append or insert a new item for the list.

element.name: TItemPropList.Delete
element.short: Removes an item in the container at the specified position

descr.p: Delete is a procedure used to remove an item in the container at the specified position. Index is the ordinal position for the item in the range 0..Count-1.
Use Clear to remove all items in the container.

element.name: TItemPropList.Delete.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the item

element.name: TItemPropList.Exchange
element.short: Swaps the items at the specified positions

descr.p: Exchange is a procedure used to swap the items at the specified positions in the list. Exchange calls the corresponding method in TFPObjectList using Index1 and Index2 as arguments. Exchange is used in the implementation of the TValueListStrings.Exchange method.

element.name: TItemPropList.Exchange.Index1
element.short: Ordinal position for the item to be swapped

element.name: TItemPropList.Exchange.Index2
element.short: Ordinal position for the item to be swapped

element.name: TItemPropList.Insert
element.short: Insert the new item at the specified position in the container

descr.p: Insert is a procedure used to insert the new item in the container at the specified position. Index specifies the ordinal position in the range 0..Count-1 where the item will be stored. AValue is the TItemProp instance to store at the specified position. Insert calls the corresponding method in TFPObjectList using Index and AValue as arguments.
Use Add to append a new item to the container.

element.name: TItemPropList.Insert.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the new item

element.name: TItemPropList.Insert.AValue
element.short: New item to insert into the list

element.name: TItemPropList.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the container. Create stores the value in AOwner as the owner of the container. Create allocates the internal TFPObjectList instance used to store Items in the list; objects in the list are owner by the container.

element.name: TItemPropList.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy is the destructor for the class instance. Destroy ensures that resources allocated to the internal list are freed; objects in the list are free as well. Destroy calls the inherited destructor.

element.name: TItemPropList.Count
element.short: Indicates the number of items in the list for the container

descr.p: Count is a read-only Integer property that indicates the number of items in the internal list for the container. Count returns the value from the TFPObjectList.Count property.

element.name: TItemPropList.Items
element.short: Provides access to items in the container by their ordinal position

descr.p: Items is an indexed TItemProp property that provides access to items in the container by their ordinal position. Index is the ordinal position in the container in the range 0..Count-1.
Items is the default property for the class.
Use Add to append a new item in the container. Use Insert to insert an item in the list at a specific position.

element.name: TValueListStrings
element.short: Stores values and item definitions used in TValueListEditor

descr.p: TValueListStrings is a TStringList descendant used to store keys, values, and item definitions used in TValueListEditor. TValueListStrings provides methods needed to add, maintain, and sort the content in the class instance.
Duplicates the functionality of TStringList.QuickSort, but also sorts the ItemProps.

element.name: TValueListStrings.InsertItem
element.short: Inserts an item with the specified value at the position in Index

descr.p: InsertItem is an overloaded procedure used to insert an item with the specified value at the position in Index. InsertItem uses properties and methods in the TValueListEditor that owns the class instance to invalidate its cached row and to hide a visible editor in the control. InsertItem calls the TItemPropList.Insert method to insert a new item definition at the position in Index. A Visible editor in TValueListEditor is restored after the item has been inserted.

element.name: TValueListStrings.InsertItem.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the new item and value

element.name: TValueListStrings.InsertItem.S
element.short: Value for the new item

element.name: TValueListStrings.Put
element.short: Stores a value at the specified ordinal position

descr.p: Put is a procedure used to store a value at the specified ordinal position. Put ensures that the TValueListEditor which owns the class hides a visible editor for the specified ordinal position. Put calls the inherited method to store the value in S at the position in Index. A visible editor in TValueListEditor is restored when needed.

element.name: TValueListStrings.Put.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the value

element.name: TValueListStrings.Put.S
element.short: Value to store at the specified position

element.name: TValueListStrings.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance. Create calls the inherited constructor. Create uses the value in AOwner as the owner of the class instance. Create allocates resources need for the internal TItemPropList used for item defintions.

element.name: TValueListStrings.Create.AOwner
element.short: TValueListEditor that owns the class instance

element.name: TValueListStrings.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy is the destructor for the class instance. Destroy ensures that resources allocated for internal item definitions are freed. Destroy calls the inherited destructor.

element.name: TValueListStrings.Assign
element.short: Stores properties from Source in the current class instance

descr.p: Assign is a procedure used to store properties from Source in the current class instance. Assign uses the TValueListEditor which own the class instance to invalidate cached rows in the control. Assign calls Clear to remove any existing values and to prevent an exception when sorting values. Assign calls the inherited method using Source as an argument. If Source is a TValueListStrings class instance, its internal item definitions are stored in the current class instance.

element.name: TValueListStrings.Clear
element.short: Removes all item values and definitions in the class

descr.p: Clear is a procedure used to remove all item values and definitions in the class instance. Clear uses the TValueListEditor which owns the class instance to clear its cached rows, and to hide a visibile editor in the control. Clear calls the inherited method, and clears the internal list of item definitions for the class. TValueListEditor restores a visible editor when needed.

element.name: TValueListStrings.CustomSort
element.short: Provides access to the QuickSortStringsAndItemProps method

descr.p: CustomSort is an overridden procedure re-implemented to provide access to the inherited QuickSortStringsAndItemProps method.

element.name: TValueListStrings.CustomSort.Compare
element.short: Comparison routine for the sorting operation

element.name: TValueListStrings.Delete
element.short: Deletes the item value and definition at the specified position

descr.p: Delete is a procedure used to delete the item value and definition at the specified ordinal position. Delete uses the TValueListEditor that owns the class to invalidate any cached rows in the control. A visible editor in the control is also hidden. Delete calls the inherited method using Index as an argument. Deletes removes the internal item definition at the position speecified in Index. A visible editor in TValueListEditor is restored when needed.

element.name: TValueListStrings.Delete.Index
element.short: Ordinal position of the value and definition to delete

element.name: TValueListStrings.Exchange
element.short: Swaps the values and item definitions at the specified positions

descr.p: Exchange is a procedure used to swap the values and item definitions at the specified positions. Exchange uses the TValueListEditor that owns the class to invalidate any cached rows in the control. A visible editor in the control is also hidden. Exchange calls the inherited method using the values in Index1 and Index2 as arguments. Exchange swaps the item defintions at the specified positions as well. A visible editor in TValueListEditor is restored when needed.

element.name: TValueListStrings.Exchange.Index1
element.short: Position of the item value and definition to swap

element.name: TValueListStrings.Exchange.Index2
element.short: Position of the item value and definition to swap

descr.p: TKeyValuePair is a record type used to store Key and Value information for rows in TValueListEditor. TKeyValuePair is used when an editor is activated for a row in TValueListEditor.

element.name: TKeyValuePair.Key
element.short: Key data a row

element.name: TKeyValuePair.Value
element.short: Value data for a row

element.name: TDisplayOption
element.short: Enumeration type with values that define display capabiities in TValueListEditor

descr.p: TDisplayOption is an enumeration type with values that define display capabiities in TValueListEditor. TDisplayOption is the type stored in the TDisplayOptions set.

element.name: TDisplayOption.doColumnTitles
element.short: Displays column titles

element.name: TDisplayOption.doAutoColResize
element.short: Automatcally resizes columns to the width of its content

element.name: TDisplayOption.doKeyColFixed
element.short: Displays the Key names column as a fixed caption column

element.name: TDisplayOptions
element.short: Set type used to store TDisplayOption enumeration values

descr.p: TDisplayOptions is a set type used to store values from the TDisplayOption enumeration. TDisplayOptions is the type used for the TValueListEditor.DisplayOptions property.
TKeyOption is an enumeration type with values that control Key actions for Key-Value data in TValueListEditor. TKeyOption values are stored in the TKeyOptions set type.

element.name: TKeyOption.keyEdit
element.short: Allows editing of Key data

element.name: TKeyOption.keyAdd
element.short: Allows adding new Key data

element.name: TKeyOption.keyDelete
element.short: Allows deleting Key data

element.name: TKeyOption.keyUnique
element.short: Key data must be unique

element.name: TKeyOptions
element.short: Stores values from the TKeyOption enumeration

descr.p: TKeyOptions is a set type used to store values from the TKeyOption enumeration. TKeyOptions is the type used to implement the TValueListEditor.KeyOptions property.

element.name: TGetPickListEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled when loading the PickList for an item in TValueListEditor

descr.p: TGetPickListEvent is an object procedure which specifies an event handler signalled when loading the PickList for an item in TValueListEditor. TGetPickListEvent allows the application to provide custom PickList values for an item using esPickList editor style.
TGetPickListEvent is the type used for the TValueListEditor.OnGetPickList event handler.

element.name: TGetPickListEvent.Sender
element.short: TValueListEditor for the event notification

element.name: TGetPickListEvent.KeyName
element.short: Key name for the selected row

element.name: TGetPickListEvent.Values
element.short: Pick list values for the selected row

element.name: TOnValidateEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled when changes to a row in TValueListEditor are validated

descr.p: TOnValidateEvent is an object procedure type that specifies an event handler signalled when changes to a row in TValueListEditor are validated. Arguments passed to the event hander identify the control, row and col in the control, and the Key name and data.
TOnValidateEvent is the type used to implement the TValueListEditor.OnValidate event handler property.

element.name: TOnValidateEvent.Sender
element.short: TValueListEditor instance for the event notification

element.name: TOnValidateEvent.ACol
element.short: Column number in the control

element.name: TOnValidateEvent.ARow
element.short: Row number on the control

element.name: TOnValidateEvent.KeyName
element.short: Key name for the modified row

element.name: TOnValidateEvent.KeyValue
element.short: Key data for the modified row

element.name: TValueListEditor
element.short: A visual component for editing Key-Value pairs

descr.p: TValueListEditor is a TCustomStringGrid descendant which implements an editor control for Key-Value pairs. TValueListEditor displays a two column grid where the first column is read-only, listing the key names. The second column is for editing the associated values. The value column supports masks, combobox selection, and a popup-dialog through an ellipsis button.

TValueListEditor support item definitions in the control using the ItemProps property. TValueListEditor provides properties to access the Keys, Values, and Strings in the control. Features and behavior for the control can be specified using the Options, DisplayOptions, and KeyOptions properties.
TValueListEditor implements method which can be used to perform editing actions in the control, such as: Clear, DeleteRow, DeleteColRow, FindRow, InsertRow, InsertRowWithValues, and Sort.

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetItemProp
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed ItemProps property

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetItemProp.AKeyOrIndex
element.short: Key name or position for the item definition

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetItemProp.Result
element.short: Item definition for the specified key name or position

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetItemProp
element.short: Sets the value for the indexed ItemProps property

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetItemProp.AKeyOrIndex
element.short: Key name or position for the item definition

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetItemProp.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TValueListEditor.StringsChange
element.short: Implements the OnChange event handler for the Strings property

element.name: TValueListEditor.StringsChange.Sender
element.short: Component triggering the event notification

element.name: TValueListEditor.StringsChanging
element.short: Implements the OnChanging event handler in the Strings property

element.name: TValueListEditor.StringsChanging.Sender
element.short: Component triggering the event notification

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetOptions
element.short: Gets the value for the Options property

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetOptions.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetKey
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed Keys property

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetKey.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetKey.Index
element.short: Position for the Key name in Keys

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetValue
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed Values property

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetValue.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetValue.Key
element.short: Key name to find in the method

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetDisplayOptions
element.short: Sets the values in the DisplayOptions property

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetDisplayOptions.AValue
element.short: New values for the property

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetDropDownRows
element.short: Sets the value in the DropDownRows property

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetDropDownRows.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetKeyOptions
element.short: Sets the values in the KeyOptions property

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetKeyOptions.AValue
element.short: New values for the property

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetKey
element.short: Sets the value in the indexed Keys property

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetKey.Index
element.short: Position of the Key name in component

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetKey.Value
element.short: New value for the Key name

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetValue
element.short: Sets the value in the indexed Values property

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetValue.Key
element.short: Key name for the specified value

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetValue.Value
element.short: New value for the specified Key name

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetOptions
element.short: Sets the values in the Options property

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetStrings
element.short: Sets the values in the Strings property

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetStrings.AValue
element.short: New values for the property

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetTitleCaptions
element.short: Sets the values in the TitleCaptions property

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetTitleCaptions.AValue
element.short: New values for the property

element.name: TValueListEditor.WSRegisterClass
element.short: Registers the class type for the widget set

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetFixedCols
element.short: Sets the value for the FixedCols property

descr.p: SetFixedCols is a procedure used to set the value for the FixedCols property.

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetFixedCols.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TValueListEditor.ShowColumnTitles
element.short: Assigns and displays the column titles for the Key and Value columns

descr.p: ShowColumnTitles is a procedure used to assign and display the column titles for the Key and Value columns in the component. ShowColumnTitles requires that column titles be enabled by including the value doColumnTitles in the DisplayOptions property. No actions are performed in the method if column titles have not been enabled.
The values used for column titles are derived from resource strings, or the TitleCaptions property (when assigned). The default values are:

dl.dd: Resource string with the caption for the Key column
Resource string with the caption for the Value column

descr.p: Values in TitleCaptions are used when the property contains a value at the following ordinal positions:

dl.dd: Value used as the caption for the Key column
Value used as the caption for the Value column

descr.p: ShowColumnTitles uses the Cells property to assign the corresponding values to the first row in the component.
ShowColumnTitles is performed automatically when the component is created, and when values in DisplayOptions and TitleCaptions are changed.

element.name: TValueListEditor.AdjustRowCount
element.short: Sets the number of visible rows for the control

descr.p: AdjustRowCount is a procedure used to set the number of visible rows for the control. AdjustRowCount uses the Strings property to get the total number of rows needed for the control, including the fixed caption row (if needed). When the value differs from RowCount, the Row and RowCount properties are updated.
AdjustRowCount is called from the StringsChange and TitlesChanged methods, and when values in DisplayOptions are changed.

element.name: TValueListEditor.ColRowExchanged
element.short: Exchanges row values at the specified positions

descr.p: ColRowExchanged is a procedure used to exchange row values at the specified positions. ColRowExchanged extends the inherited method by applying the changes to the Strings property after adjusting the index positions for the number of FixedRows in the control. ColRowExchanged calls the inherited method using IsColumn, Index, and WithIndex as arguments.

element.name: TValueListEditor.ColRowExchanged.IsColumn
element.short: Indicates if the exchange applies to the column only or the entire row

element.name: TValueListEditor.ColRowExchanged.Index
element.short: First position to be swapped

element.name: TValueListEditor.ColRowExchanged.WithIndex
element.short: Second position to be swapped

element.name: TValueListEditor.ColRowDeleted
element.short: Performs actions needed when a row is deleted in the component

descr.p: ColRowDeleted is an overridden procedure used to perform actions needed when a Key-Value row is deleted in the component. ColRowDeleted ensures that EditorMode is set to False, and deletes the active row in the Strings property. ColRowDeleted calls the inherited method using IsColumn and Index as arguments.

element.name: TValueListEditor.ColRowDeleted.IsColumn
element.short: Indicates the action is for a column (and not a row)

element.name: TValueListEditor.ColRowDeleted.Index
element.short: Ordinal position of the affected item

element.name: TValueListEditor.DefineCellsProperty
element.short: Not used in the current implementation

descr.remark: DefineCellsProperty has an empty implementation in TValueListEditor to prevent reading and writing the Cells property as defined in an ancestor class.

element.name: TValueListEditor.DefineCellsProperty.Filer
element.short: Component streamer for the class

element.name: TValueListEditor.InvalidateCachedRow
element.short: Resets the last edited row number for the component

descr.p: InvalidateCachedRow is a procedure used to invalidate the internal member variable used to track the last row edited in the component. When Strings contains data, the internal tracker is set to -1. When Strings has no data (length is 0), the internal tracker defaults to the first visibile non-fixed row. The editing buffer for Key and Value are also cleared.
InvalidateCachedRow is called when the TValueListStrings instance in Strings performs Add, Delete, Insert, and Sort operations.

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetAutoFillColumnInfo
element.short: Gets the display priority for a column

descr.p: GetAutoFillColumnInfo is a procedure used to get the minimum and maximum width, as well as the relative display priority, for an automatically sized column in the grid. GetAutoFillColumnInfo overrides the behavior from an ancestor class to account for the two column grid used in the component. Index is the column number examined in the method. When Index is 1 (the Value column), the relative priority is set to 1. When Index is 0 (the Key column), DisplayOptions is used to determine if the Key column is fixed. The priority is 0 when fixed, or 1 when DisplayOptions does not include the value doKeyColFixed.
descr.remark: Values in the aMin and aMax arguments are not used; they were used in an ancestor class, but are not required in TValueListEditor.

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetAutoFillColumnInfo.Index
element.short: Column number examined in the method

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetAutoFillColumnInfo.aMin
element.short: Not used in TValueListEditor

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetAutoFillColumnInfo.aMax
element.short: Not used in TValueListEditor

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetAutoFillColumnInfo.aPriority
element.short: Relative display priority for the column

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetEditText
element.short: Gets the value used in the editor for the specified cell

descr.p: GetEditText is a String function used to get the value used in the editor for the cell at the specified coordinates. The return vaslue contain the content in Cells stored at the coordinates specified in ACol and ARow. GetEditText signals the OnGetEditText event handler (when assigned) to allow a custom value to be provided to the cell editor.

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetEditText.Result
element.short: Value for the cell editor

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetEditText.ACol
element.short: Column number

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetEditText.ARow
element.short: Row number

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetCells
element.short: Gets the value in Cells at the specified row and column numbers

descr.p: GetCells is a String function used to get the value in the Cells property at the specified row and column numbers. GetCells extends the behavior from the ancestor class by using the Strings property as the source of data in the component. When ACol contains 0 (the Key column), the Names property in Strings is used to get the value for the current row. When ACol contains 1 (the Value column), the ValueFromIndex method in Strings is used to get the value for the current row.

The return value is an empty string ('') when ARow is 0 (zero) and column titles are enabled in DisplayOptions. Use the TitleCaptions property to set the values displayed when DisplayOptions includes the value doColumnTitles.

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetCells.Result
element.short: Value for the cell at the specified row and column number

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetCells.ACol
element.short: Column number to read in Cells

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetCells.ARow
element.short: Row number to read in Cells

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetDefaultEditor
element.short: Gets the editor control for the specified column number

descr.p: GetDefaultEditor is a TWinControl function used to get the editor control for the specified column number. The return value is the TWinControl used as the editor for the cell in the specified column number.

GetDefaultEditor saves the current contents in Cells for the selected Row number to allow use of RestoreCurrentRow. GetDefaultEditor calls the inherited method to enable the logic implemented in the ancestor class.

KeyOptions is used to determine if the VK_Delete key needs to be be handled in the editor control. EditorOptions is updated to include or exclude the value EO_HOOKKEYDOWN based on the presence of KeyDelete in KeyOptions.

When Column contains 1 (the Value column), GetDefaultEditor retrieves the ItemProps item defintion in Strings for the specified column number. Its EditStyle is applied by calling the EditorByStyle method. For a PickList-style editor, pick list values in the item defintion are assigned to the ComboBox editor control and its drop-down row count is set to the value in DropDownRows. In addition, the OnGetPickList event handler is signalled (when assigned) to allow use of user-defined values in the editor control. The read-only status for the editor is updated to reflect the value in the item defintion.
When Column contains 0 (the Key column), the editor is marked as read-only when KeyOptions does not include the value KeyEdit.

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetDefaultEditor.Column
element.short: Column number for the editor control

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetDefaultEditor.Result
element.short: Editor control for the specified column number

element.name: TValueListEditor.GetRowCount.Result
element.short: Row count for the component

element.name: TValueListEditor.KeyDown
element.short: Provides support for special keys used in the component

descr.p: KeyDown is a procedure used to provide support for special keys used in the component. KeyDown calls the inherited method. The KeyOptions property is used to determine if actions are performed for the corresponding keystrokes, including:

dl.dd: Inserts a row at the current position. by calling InsertRow. Key is set to #0.
Deletes the row at the current position by calling DeleteRow. Key is set to #0.
Restores the values for the current row by calling RestoreCurrentRow. Key is set to #0.

element.name: TValueListEditor.KeyDown.Key
element.short: Key code value

element.name: TValueListEditor.KeyDown.Shift
element.short: Shift state value

element.name: TValueListEditor.ResetDefaultColWidths
element.short: Resets columns to their default widths

descr.p: ResetDefaultColWidths is a procedure used to reset columns to their default widths for the component. ResetDefaultColWidths uses values in the AutoFillColumns and DisplayOptions properties to determine the actions required in the method. When AutoFillColumns contains False, the inherited ResetDefaultColWidths method is called to set the default column widths.

Otherwise, DisplayOptions is used to determine if the Key column is displayed as a fixed column. When DisplayOptions contains the value doKeyColFixed, the Key column (column 0) is resized to fit the longest value in the Keys property and the component is redrawn.
No actions are performed in the method when AutoFillColumns contains True and DisplayOptions does not include the value doKeyColFixed.

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetCells
element.short: Sets the value in the Cells property at the specified position

descr.p: SetCells is an overridden procedure used to set the value in the Cells property at the specified row and column position. SetCells ensures that values written to the Cells property are also stored in the Strings property using the "Key=Value" convention used in the component. The new cell value in AValue is applied to either the Key or the Value based on the column number in ACol (0 is for Key, 1 is for Value).

Cells with a row number of 0 (zero) are used for fixed title captions when they are enabled in the DisplayOptions for the component. When DisplayOptions contains the value doColumnTitles, the inherited SetCells method is called to display the new title caption entered at run-time. Use TitleCaptions to set the column title captions at design-time.
Use Cells to read or write values in the property.

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetCells.ACol
element.short: Column number for the new cell value

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetCells.ARow
element.short: Row number for the new cell value

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetCells.AValue
element.short: New value for the cell

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetEditText
element.short: Sets the cell value at the specified position

descr.p: SetEditText is an overridden procedure used to set the value for the cell at the specified row and column position. SetEditText calls the inherited method, and stores the string in AValue in the Cells for the component.

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetEditText.ACol
element.short: Column number for the new value

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetEditText.ARow
element.short: Row number for the new value

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetEditText.Value
element.short: Value to store in the Cells for the component

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetFixedRows
element.short: Sets the value in the FixedRows property

descr.p: SetFixedRows is a procedure used to set the value in the FixedRows property. SetFixedRows is overriden in TValueListEditor to update the DisplayOptions for the component when the property value is changed. AValue is the number of fixed rows to use for title captions in the control. No actions are performed in the method when AValue contains a value other than 0 or 1.

SetFixedRows updates the DisplayOptions property to reflect the requested value in AValue. When AValue is 0, the value doColumnTitles is excluded from the DisplayOptions property. When AValue is 1, the value doColumnTitles is included in the DisplayOptions property.
Use TitleCaptions to set the title captions for columns at design-time. Use DisplayOptions to enable or disable title captions for the component.

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetFixedRows.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetRowCount
element.short: Sets the value in the RowCount property

descr.p: SetRowCount is an overridden procedure used to set the value in the RowCount property. AValue specifies the new value for the property. SetRowCount uses the value in RowCount to determine if any actions are required in the method. No actions are performed in the method when RowCount contains the same value as AValue. The new row count value is adjusted to account for the value in FixedRows.

SetRowCount provides support for the Strings property used in the component. When the new row count value is different than the number of entries in Strings, lines are added to or removed from Strings until the number of rows are the same.

element.name: TValueListEditor.SetRowCount.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TValueListEditor.Sort
element.short: Sorts the values in Strings

descr.p: Sort is a procedure used to sort the values in Strings. Sort disables an active editor in the component prior to sorting values when Options includes the value goAlwaysShowEditor. The active editor is restored when the sorting operation is completed.

Sort calls the inherited Sort method using the values in Index, IndxFrom, and IndxTo as arguments. Please note that the ColSorting is not actually used in the sort operation; the True is always used for column sorting.

element.name: TValueListEditor.Sort.ColSorting
element.short: Not used n the current implementation

element.name: TValueListEditor.TitlesChanged
element.short: Default event handler signalled when TitleCaptions is changed

descr.p: TitlesChanged is a procedure which provides a default implementation for the event handler signalled when values in TitleCaptions are changed. TitlesChanged calls ShowColumnTitles and AdjustRowCount methods to update the component, and calls Invalidate to force the component to be redrawn.
TitlesChanged is assigned to the OnChange event handler in TitleCaptions when the component is created.

element.name: TValueListEditor.TitlesChanged.Sender
element.short: Component triggering the event notification

element.name: TValueListEditor.ValidateEntry
element.short: Validates data entered in a cell in the component

descr.p: ValidateEntry is an overridden Boolean function used to validate data entered in a cell in the component. The return value is True if NewValue is acceptable for use in the cell at the specified coordinates.

ValidateEntry calls the inherited method, which also signals the OnValidateEntry event handler. ValidateEntry extends the ancestor class to check for duplicate names in the Key column when the value KeyUnique is included in the KeyOptions property. The return value is False if a duplicate Key name is found in Strings. A dialog message is displayed with the message in rsVLEDuplicateKey, and the Editor re-selects the content to resolve the duplicate value.

element.name: TValueListEditor.ValidateEntry.ACol
element.short: Column number for the new value

element.name: TValueListEditor.ValidateEntry.ARow
element.short: Row number for the new value

element.name: TValueListEditor.ValidateEntry.OldValue
element.short: The old value for the cell

element.name: TValueListEditor.ValidateEntry.NewValue
element.short: The new value for the cell

element.name: TValueListEditor.ValidateEntry.Result
element.short: True if the cell value is valid

element.name: TValueListEditor.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance. Create allocates resources for the Strings and TitleCaptions properties, and calls the inherited constructor. Creates set the event handlers in Strings and TitleCaptions to the methods in the class instance. Create sets the default values for the following properties:

dl.dd: [ goFixedVertLine, goFixedHorzLine, goVertLine, goHorzLine, goColSizing, goEditing, goAlwaysShowEditor, goThumbTracking ]

descr.p: Create initializes the value for internal member variable used to track the last row edited in the component.

element.name: TValueListEditor.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the component instance

element.name: TValueListEditor.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy is the destructor for the class instance. Destroy frees resources allocated to the Strings and TitleCaptions properties, and calls the inherited Destroy method.

element.name: TValueListEditor.Clear
element.short: Removes the content in the component

descr.p: Clear is a procedure used to remove the content in the component. Clear calls the Clear method in Strings to remove the Name/Value information stored in the property.

element.name: TValueListEditor.DeleteColRow
element.short: Deletes the column or row at the specified position

descr.p: DeleteColRow is a procedure used to delete the column or row at the specified position. IsColumn indicates whether the action is intended for a column or a row. Index is the ordinal position of the row or column in the component.
When IsColumn contains True, the DeleteCol method is called to remove the specified column number. Otherwise, the DeleteRow method is called to remove the specified row number.

element.name: TValueListEditor.DeleteColRow.IsColumn
element.short: True when a column is affected in the method

element.name: TValueListEditor.DeleteColRow.Index
element.short: Position of the row or column in the component

element.name: TValueListEditor.DeleteRow
element.short: Deletes the row at the specified position

descr.p: DeleteRow is an overridden procedure used to delete row at the specified position in the component. DeleteRow ensures that the row specified in Index is not a fixed title caption, and that Strings contains data. No actions are performed in the method when these conditions are not met.
DeleteRow calls the inherited method to remove the specified row number in the component.

element.name: TValueListEditor.DeleteRow.Index
element.short: Position of the row to be deleted

element.name: TValueListEditor.DeleteCol
element.short: Deletes the column at the specified position

descr.p: DeleteCol is an overridden procedure in TValueListEditor. DeleteCol is not a valid operation for the component, and is overridden to prevent access to the inherited method. DeleteCol raises an EGridException exception with the message in rsVLEInvalidRowColOperation.

errors.p: EGridException exception raised with the message in rsVLEInvalidRowColOperation.

element.name: TValueListEditor.DeleteCol.Index
element.short: Position of the column to be deleted

element.name: TValueListEditor.FindRow
element.short: Locates the row with the specified Key name

descr.p: FindRow is a Boolean function used to locate the row with the specified Key name in the component. aRow contains the relative row number where KeyName was located. The row mumber is relative to the fixed title caption row (when visible).The value in aRow is not updated if KeyName is not found in Strings.
The return value is True when KeyName exists in the Strings property.

element.name: TValueListEditor.FindRow.KeyName
element.short: Key name to locate in the method

element.name: TValueListEditor.FindRow.aRow
element.short: Relative row number for the specified key name

element.name: TValueListEditor.FindRow.Result
element.short: True when the key name exists in the component

element.name: TValueListEditor.InsertColRow
element.short: Inserts a row or column at the specified position

descr.p: InsertColRow is a procedure used to add a row or column at the specified position in the component. IsColumn indicates if a column is being inserted in the method. When IsColumn contains False, a row is inserted at the specified position. Index contains the row number where a blank item is inserted in Strings. Index is relative the number of FixedRows in the component; ie. when FixedRows = 1 and Index = 1, the item is inserted at position 0 in Strings. When FixedRows = 0 and Index = 1, the item is inserted at position 1 in Strings.
When IsColumn contains True, an EGridException exception is raised with the message in rsVLEInvalidRowColOperation. Inserting a column is not a valid operation in TValueListEditor.

errors.p: Raises an EGridException exception with the message in rsVLEInvalidRowColOperation when adding a column in the control.

element.name: TValueListEditor.InsertColRow.IsColumn
element.short: False if the insert operation is for a row

element.name: TValueListEditor.InsertColRow.Index
element.short: Relative position for the inserted column

element.name: TValueListEditor.InsertRow
element.short: Inserts a row at the specified position

descr.p: InsertRow is an Integer function used to insert a row with the specified KeyName and Value at the current Row in the component. Append indicates if the inserted row is added after the current Row in the component. When Append is False, the values in KeyName and Value are inserted at the current row. Row is updated to reflect the row number for the inserted values.
The return value contains the row number relative to the fixed title captions where the KeyName and Value were inserted.

element.name: TValueListEditor.InsertRow.KeyName
element.short: Key name to use in the new row

element.name: TValueListEditor.InsertRow.Value
element.short: Value to use in the new row

element.name: TValueListEditor.InsertRow.Append
element.short: True if a row is inserted after the current row

element.name: TValueListEditor.InsertRow.Result
element.short: Relative row number for the inserted row

element.name: TValueListEditor.InsertRowWithValues
element.short: Inserts a row with the specified values at the specified position

descr.p: InsertRowWithValues is a procedure used to insert a row with the specified values at the specified row number in the component. Index contains the position in Strings where the new row is inserted.

Values is an array of Strings with the Key name and value for the inserted row. Values should contain two elements in the array. The first is the key name. The second is the value. The second array element can be omitted, and defaults to an empty string (''). No other elements in the array are used in the method.
InsertRowWithValues inserts the key name and value in Strings at the specified position using the "Key=Value" convention used in the component.

element.name: TValueListEditor.InsertRowWithValues.Index
element.short: Position for the inserted row

element.name: TValueListEditor.InsertRowWithValues.Values
element.short: Array with the key name and value for the inserted row

element.name: TValueListEditor.ExchangeColRow
element.short: Swaps the columns or rows at the specified positions

descr.p: ExchangeColRow is an overridden procedure used to swap the columns or rows at the specified positions in the component. IsColumn indicates if the exchanged values are in a column or in a row in the component. The two-column layout in TValueListEditor prevents exchanging column values. When IsColumn contains True, an EGridException exception is raised with the message in rsVLEInvalidRowColOperation.
When IsColumn contains False, the inherited ExchangeColRow method is called using Index and WithIndex as arguments.

errors.p: EGridException raised with the message in rsVLEInvalidRowColOperation when exchanging column values in the component.

element.name: TValueListEditor.ExchangeColRow.IsColumn
element.short: False when exchanging row values

element.name: TValueListEditor.ExchangeColRow.Index
element.short: Position for one of the exchanged values

element.name: TValueListEditor.ExchangeColRow.WithIndex
element.short: Position for one of the exchanged values

element.name: TValueListEditor.IsEmptyRow
element.short: Indicates if the specified row is empty

descr.p: IsEmptyRow is an overloaded Boolean function used to determine the Key name and Value for a row contain empty string values (''). One variant omits a row number parameter, and assumes the current row is used for the comparison. The other variant includes a row number, and performs the actual string comparisons.
The return value is True when Strings contains no entries, or when Cells for the specified row number have empty string values ('') in both columns in the component.

element.name: TValueListEditor.IsEmptyRow.aRow
element.short: Row number to examine in the method

element.name: TValueListEditor.IsEmptyRow.Result
element.short: True if the specified row has empty key name and value cells

element.name: TValueListEditor.MoveColRow
element.short: Moves the specified column or row to the new position

descr.p: MoveColRow is a procedure used to move the specified column or row to the new position. IsColumn indicates if the positions are in a column or in a row in the component. The two-column layout in TValueListEditor prevents moving column values. When IsColumn contains True, an EGridException exception is raised with the message in rsVLEInvalidRowColOperation.
When IsColumn contains False, the values in Strings stored at the relative position in FromIndex are deleted. The values are re-inserted in Strings at the relative position in ToIndex.

element.name: TValueListEditor.MoveColRow.IsColumn
element.short: True if the operation affects a column

element.name: TValueListEditor.MoveColRow.FromIndex
element.short: Original position of the row or column

element.name: TValueListEditor.MoveColRow.ToIndex
element.short: Target position for the row or column

element.name: TValueListEditor.RestoreCurrentRow
element.short: Restores pre-editing values in the current row

descr.p: RestoreCurrentRow is a Boolean function used to restore the values for the current row to their state prior to editing in the component. If an editor has been assigned and has focus, it is hidden by calling EditorHide. Values in the internal TKeyValuePair for the last row edited are restored in the Cells for the current Row. The EditorShow method is called to show the active editor after the row values are restored.

The return value True if the pre-editing values were successfully restored in the current Row. The return is False if values were not edited, or an editor was not assigned and focused in the component.

element.name: TValueListEditor.RestoreCurrentRow.Result
element.short: True if the values were successfully restored in the current row

element.name: TValueListEditor.Sort
element.short: Sorts values in the component by the names in the Key column

descr.p: Sort is an overloaded procedure used to sort values in the component by the names in the Key column.

element.name: TValueListEditor.Sort.Index
element.short: Ordinal position of the column for the sort operation

element.name: TValueListEditor.Sort.ACol
element.short: Column used for the sort operation

element.name: TValueListEditor.Modified
element.short: Indicates if changes have been made in the component

descr.p: Modified is a Boolean property which indicates if values in the component have been modified. Modified is updated in the StringsChange event handler method when values in the Strings property have been added, changed, or deleted.

element.name: TValueListEditor.Keys
element.short: Provides indexed access to Key names in the component

descr.p: Keys is an indexed String property which provides access to key names in the component. Index specifies the ordinal row number in Cells used to read or write the value for the property. The column number in Cells is always 0 (the Key column).
Use Values to access the value for a specifc Key name in the component.

element.name: TValueListEditor.Keys.Index
element.short: Row number for the Key name in the component

element.name: TValueListEditor.Values
element.short: Provides indexed access to Values in the component

descr.p: Values is an indexed String property which provides access to values for Key names in the component. Key is a String value with the key name to locate in the Strings for the component. The property value is read from and written to the Cells property in the Value column (1). If Key does not already exist during write access, a new Key/Value pair is added to Strings.
Use Keys to read or write key names in the component.

element.name: TValueListEditor.Values.Key
element.short: Key name for the specified value

element.name: TValueListEditor.ItemProps
element.short: Provides indexed access to item definitions in the component

descr.p: ItemProps is an indexed TItemProp property which provides access to item definitions used in the component. ItemProps provides properties and methods to define the editor used for a Key-Value pair. These include the editor style, editing mask, maximum length, pick list values, and read-only status for the item.

AKeyOrIndex is a variant value that specifies the Key name (String) or the ordinal position (Integer) for the TItemProp instance in the property. Read and write access to ItemProps is redirected to the TItemPropList in the Strings property.

element.name: TValueListEditor.ItemProps.AKeyOrIndex
element.short: Key name or position for the item definition

element.name: TValueListEditor.OnEditButtonClick
element.short: Deprecated; use OnButtonClick

element.name: TValueListEditor.OnGetPickList
element.short: Event handler signalled when loading the PickList for an item

descr.p: OnGetPickList is a TGetPickListEvent property that provides an event handler signalled when loading the PickList for an item with a specific Key name. OnGetPickList allows the application to provide custom PickList values for an item using esPickList editor style.

element.name: TValueListEditor.OnStringsChange
element.short: Event handler signalled when values in the Strings property are changed

descr.p: OnStringsChange is a TNotifyEvent property that implement the event handler signalled when values in the Strings property are changed. Applications can assign a procedure to the event handler to perform action needed in the component. OnStringsChange is triggered in the StringsChange method after updating the row count and redrawing the component.
Use OnStringsChanging to perform actions needed prior to setting values in Strings.

element.name: TValueListEditor.OnStringsChanging
element.short: Event handler signalled prior to updating the Strings property

descr.p: OnStringsChanging is a TNotifyEvent property that implements the event handler signalled prior to updating values in the Strings property. Applications can aassign a procedure to the event handler to respond to the event notification. OnStringsChanging is triggered in the StringsChanging method.
Use OnStringsChange to perform actions needed after values are updated in Strings.

element.name: TValueListEditor.OnValidate
element.short: Not used in the current implementation

descr.p: OnValidate is a TOnValidateEvent property that implements the event handler signalled when?!? Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: TValueListEditor.DisplayOptions
element.short: Enables or disables display features and behaviors in the component

descr.p: DisplayOptions is a TDisplayOptions property which enables or disables display features and behaviors in the component. DisplayOptions is a set type, and can store 0 (zero) or more TDisplayOption values. The default value for the property includes the following enumeration values:

dl.dd: Displays the Key as a fixed caption column

descr.p: Changing the value in DisplayOptions may require updates to the RowCount and FixedRows properties; they are adjusted to reflect the current status for doColumnTitles in the property. In addition, the AutFillColumns property is updated to reflect the presence of doAutoColResize in the property.
The value in DisplayOptions is updated when the value in FixedRows is changed.

element.name: TValueListEditor.DropDownRows
element.short: Number of rows displayed for an item with a PickList editor style

descr.p: DropDownRows is an Integer property with the number of rows displayed for an item with a PickList editor style. The default value for the property is 8. DropDownRows is used in the GetDefaultEditor method to set the value in TComboBox.DrowDownCount for items in ItemProps using the esPickList editor style.
Use ItemProps to maintain the items defined for the component.

element.name: TValueListEditor.KeyOptions
element.short: Controls actions that can be performed for Keys in the component

descr.p: KeyOptions is a TKeyOptions property used to control actions that can be performed for Keys in the component. KeyOptions is a set type, and can contain 0 (zero) or more values from the TKeyOption enumeration. The default value for the property is an empty set ([]).

Settings the values in KeyOptions causes the internal UpdatingKeyOptions flag to be set. Including the value KeyAdd in KeyOptions requires KeyEdit to be added as well. The Options property may also be updated to include or exclude the value goAutoAddRows based on the presence of KeyAdd in the property. The internal UpdatingKeyOptions flag is cleared proper to exiting from the method.

element.name: TValueListEditor.Options
element.short: Specifies the options enabled for the two-column grid in the component

descr.p: Options is a TGridOptions property used to specify the options enabled for the two-column grid displayed in the component. Options is a set type that can contain 0 (zero) or more TGridOption values. The default values for the property include the following enumeration values:
See TGridOption for more information about values and meanings in the enumeration.

Changing the value in Options causes additional validation to be performed. goColMoving is always excluded from the property value; this is not a valid operation in TValueListEditor. goAutoAddRowsSkipContentCheck is also excluded from the property. If the internal UpdatingKeyOptions flas has not been set, and component streaming has completed, the KeyOptions property is updated to reflect the state of goAutoAddRows in the property value.

element.name: TValueListEditor.Strings
element.short: Provides storage for the Keys, Values, and item definitions in the component

descr.p: Strings is a TValueListStrings property which provides storage for the Keys, Values, and item definitions in the component. Strings uses the "Key=Value" convention to store the string data needed for the Keys and Values properties. Strings also contains an internal TItemPropList member used to store the item definitions for the component.

Use the Keys property to read and write key names by their ordinal position in the component. Use Values to read or write the data stored for a specific Key name. Use ItemPtops to maintain the item defintions in the component.

element.name: TValueListEditor.TitleCaptions
element.short: Title captions used for columns in the component

descr.p: TitleCaptions is a TStrings property with the title captions used for columns in the component. TitleCaptions should have 2 lines with the values used for the Key and Value columns in the component. When TitleCaptions is empty (0 lines), the values in rsVLEKey and rsVLEValue are used as the captions for their respective columns. If a line is omitted in TitleCaptions, the corresponding resource string is used as the default value for the caption. TitleCaptions is used in the ShowColumnTitles method to assign and display the fixed caption values.

element.name: rsVLEDuplicateKey
element.short: Message displayed when a duplicate Key name is found

element.name: rsVLEKey
element.short: Default caption for the Key column; value is 'Key'

element.name: rsVLEValue
element.short: Default caption for the Value column; value is 'Value'

element.name: rsVLEInvalidRowColOperation
element.short: Exception message for an invalid row or column operation
